headline: Review & Preview: An Avalanche of Worries
summary: The tariff tango continues: It boosted markets on Friday when the Supreme Court ruled the duties were illegal, and helped sink markets Monday when President Donald Trump forged ahead with 15% global tariffs.  The Nasdaq Composite lost 1.1%.  Stocks are trading lower in response to the fact that “this adds a new layer of uncertainty to the tariff story,” as Michael Landsberg, chief investment officer at Landsberg Bennett Private Wealth Management, puts it.

content.title: Review & Preview: An Avalanche of Worries
content.summary: The tariff tango continues: It boosted markets on Friday when the Supreme Court ruled the duties were illegal, and helped sink markets Monday when President Donald Trump forged ahead with 15% global tariffs.  The Nasdaq Composite lost 1.1%.  Stocks are trading lower in response to the fact that “this adds a new layer of uncertainty to the tariff story,” as Michael Landsberg, chief investment officer at Landsberg Bennett Private Wealth Management, puts it.

headline: How AI-Powered Air Taxis And Global Partnerships At Archer Aviation (ACHR) Have Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Archer Aviation recently outlined a series of developments, including selecting Bristol for its UK engineering hub, deepening defense collaborations, and partnering with the Government of Serbia, which obtained an option to purchase up to 25 Midnight eVTOL aircraft. The company is also working with NVIDIA to incorporate IGX Thor–based artificial intelligence into future aircraft, aiming to enhance safety-critical operations and support its planned AI-enabled air taxi test bed at Hawthorne...

headline: Nvidia results are AI market's biggest test amid competitive worries
summary: As Nvidia heads into quarterly earnings on Wednesday, AI investors are seeking evidence that the chipmaker's profits are growing apace on the back of a $630 billion capital spending budget from Big Tech.  After powering much of the U.S. stock market rally for the past three years, Nvidia's stock has risen ‌just about 2% so far in 2026.  Google is also in talks to supply Meta - a large Nvidia customer, according to media reports.

content.title: Nvidia results are AI market's biggest test amid competitive worries
content.summary: As Nvidia heads into quarterly earnings on Wednesday, AI investors are seeking evidence that the chipmaker's profits are growing apace on the back of a $630 billion capital spending budget from Big Tech.  After powering much of the U.S. stock market rally for the past three years, Nvidia's stock has risen ‌just about 2% so far in 2026.  Google is also in talks to supply Meta - a large Nvidia customer, according to media reports.
